value.title: Create your first Power BI report (2021)
value.excerpt: New to Power BI? Adam helps you get started with creating your first Power BI report in Power BI Desktop! Start your journey the right way!  Guy in a Cube Blueprint Course: https://guyinacu.be/pbiblueprint  Star Schema: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/star-schema  Star Schema Book: https://amzn.to/38JQJqq

value.title: Drilling into drillthrough in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how you can use the drillthrough feature within Power BI Desktop. He also looks at how you can drill to multiple fields at the same time. The back image can also be changed and Patrick shows you how to do it!  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com --

value.title: Power BI DAX for Beginners: AVERAGE, AVERAGEA, AVERAGEX
value.excerpt: Welcome to the complete Power BI DAX Beginner Series. During this session, we will discuss the AVERAGE function in DAX. AVERAGE function in Power BI DAX has lots of variations. During this session, we will cover AVERAGE, AVERAGEA, AVERAGEX. So, Let's get started!  The Episode covers the following information:

value.title: Getting started with Power BI Paginated Reports (2021)
value.excerpt: Not sure what Power BI Paginated Reports are or how to use them? Patrick walks you through and points you to some great resources to get up and running quickly.  Power BI Paginated Reports require either Power BI Premium Per User or Power BI Premium capacity.  Paginated Report In a Day: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/learning-catalog/paginated-reports-online-course

value.excerpt: You've got multiple fact tables in your Power BI dataset. And, dimension tables for each. Struggling to slice and dice across both? Patrick shows you how to deal with this mess. value.title: The rise of self-service BI, PowerPivot and Power BI and how it changed the world with Rob Collie
value.excerpt:
In this episode of Kasper On BI we are talking about the rise of self-service BI and how that is different from traditional BI. It...
The post The rise of self-service BI, PowerPivot and Power BI and how it changed the world with Rob Collie appeared first on Kasper On BI.

value.title: Create and use analytics reports with Power BI
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces you to Power BI, and teaches you to use and build business intelligence reports.

topItems.title: Get started building with Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power BI is a collection of software services and applications that let you connect to all sorts of data sources and create compelling visuals and reports. You can benefit from receiving those reports, or you can share them with others inside or outside your organization. Learn the basics of Power BI, how its services and applications work together, and how they can be used to create or experience compelling visuals and analytics based on your data.

topItems.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
topItems.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

topItems.title: Model data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Connect Power BI to multiple data sources to create reports. Define the relationship between your data sources.

topItems.title: Use visuals in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: Conditional Navigation is an INSANE AMAZING way to change pages in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Tired of having a ton of buttons to accommodate page navigation within your Power BI report? Conditional navigation is an INSANE AMAZING way to reduce visuals on the report and provide a clean way to navigate your report.  â¬‡ Download sample: https://guyinacu.be/cnavsample  ðŸ“¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Dynamic Power BI reports using Parameters
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how you can use a parameter, within a Power BI report, to dynamically change the data in a report. This uses M Functions within Power Query and a second source that has the key values to pull. Then using a gateway to enable refresh.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: Power BI Get Data: Import vs. DirectQuery vs. Live
value.excerpt: Import vs. DirectQuery vs. Live connection. Which do you choose and why in Power BI? Adam looks at the three options when creating reports in Power BI Desktop. value.title: 2 ways to reduce your Power BI dataset size and speed up refresh

value.title: Power BI date table: create using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to create a Power BI date table using DAX. The end result uses a combination of the GENERATE(), ROW() and CALENDARAUTO() DAX functions to create a calculated table resulting in a Power BI date table.  Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-generate-and-row-instead-of-addcolumns-in-dax/

value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that youâ€™re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that youâ€™re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: How to filter a table to show only most recent date by group in Power Query
value.excerpt: It is a best practice to load in Power Bi only the data that you need. In today's video, I will show you how you can filter a table by the last date available. value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day
value.excerpt: The Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day online course aims to empower you as a report author with the technical knowledge required to create, publish, and distribute Power BI paginated reports. We recommend you watch the videos in the recorded sequence, starting with video 1 and ending with video 24.
